activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.SplashActivity
activities.summary: The SplashActivity is typically used as the initial screen when launching the app, often serving to load resources or transition to other main activities after a short delay.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.SimpleActivity
activities.summary: This activity serves as the main interface for a clock application, providing functionalities such as displaying the current time, managing alarms, timers, and stopwatches, and navigating to other related screens.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.ReminderActivity

dynamic_properties.effect: holds all UI components of the reminder screen
shows title of the reminder, e.g., 'Time expired'
displays time-based information related to the alarm or timer
acts as a visual guide for snoozing the alarm via swipe gesture
indicates that swiping left will snooze the alarm
provides background highlight while dragging the draggable element
used for swipe gestures to snooze or dismiss the alarm
acts as a visual guide for dismissing the alarm via swipe gesture
indicates that swiping right will dismiss the alarm

static_properties.text: Swipe right to Dismiss, or left to Snooze.

dynamic_properties.effect: shows swipe instructions to interact with the alarm
stops the alarm or timer and finishes the activity

static_properties.text: Swipe right to Dismiss, or left to Snooze.

activities.summary: The ReminderActivity is responsible for handling alarm and timer reminders, including sound, vibration, snoozing, dismissing, and UI interactions. It ensures the reminder remains visible over the lockscreen, manages alarm effects, and handles user interaction such as swipe gestures or button clicks.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.SnoozeReminderActivity
activities.summary: This activity is used for handling snooze reminders, allowing the user to select a snooze duration for an alarm. It retrieves the alarm information, hides related notifications, and displays a dialog for user interaction before updating the alarm or canceling the action.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.WidgetAnalogueConfigureActivity
activities.summary: This activity is used for configuring an analogue widget, including setting background colors, adjusting transparency, and saving the configuration. It manages UI interactions like color picking, SeekBar adjustments, and broadcasting updates to the widget.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.WidgetDigitalConfigureActivity

dynamic_properties.effect: Hosts child views including configuration UI elements like color pickers and time/date preview.
Centers the configuration layout horizontally with margin padding for better UI alignment.
Groups related UI components like time, date, and background image for structured layout.
Displays the background of the widget preview with applied color and transparency.
Preview of the digital clock's time format (12/24 hour) with shadow and custom font size.
Preview of the digital clock's date format with shadow and font styling consistent with theme.
Opens a color picker dialog to choose the background color of the widget.
Aligns and contains the seekbar for adjusting background transparency.
Allows user to modify the alpha value (transparency) of the widget background dynamically.
Triggers a color picker dialog to select and apply the text color for widget text elements.
Saves the selected background and text colors, updates the widget configuration, and finishes the activity.

activities.summary: This activity is used for configuring the digital widget settings, including background color with transparency adjustment, text color selection, and saving configurations to update the widget appearance.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.IntentHandlerActivity
activities.summary: This activity is used to handle various alarm and timer operations via incoming Intents, such as setting a new alarm or timer, dismissing an existing alarm or timer, and optionally opening edit dialogs for user interaction.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.SettingsActivity

dynamic_properties.effect: shows the toolbar with the title 'Settings'.
triggers a click event handled by setupCustomizeColors() to customize app colors.
launches WidgetDigitalConfigureActivity for customizing widget colors.
launches a purchase thank you intent; hidden if previously installed.
switches the app's language to English and restarts the app.
opens an intent to change the device/app language if on Android Tiramisu or above.
enables or disables preventing the phone from sleeping based on checkbox state.
toggles whether Sunday is displayed as the first day of the week.
displays a dialog to select the maximum alarm reminder duration in seconds.
enables/disables gradual increase of alarm volume.
controls whether the same snooze time should be used across alarms.
opens a dialog to select the default snooze duration in seconds.
displays a dialog to set the maximum timer reminder duration in seconds.

activities.summary: The SettingsActivity allows users to configure various application settings, including language, color customization, alarm and timer behaviors, snooze time, and other general preferences.

activities.name: com.simplemobiletools.clock.activities.MainActivity

dynamic_properties.effect: Hosts top-level UI components like toolbar and tab layout with viewpager.
Displays and handles toolbar options such as sort, settings, and other context-dependent actions.
Contains UI elements or fragments related to the currently selected tab.
Allows swiping between different functional tabs (e.g., Alarm, Stopwatch) using RtlViewPager.
Displays bottom tabs for switching between main functions (Alarm, Stopwatch, Timer, etc.) without swiping.

activities.summary: MainActivity serves as the main interface of a clock application, managing tabs for different functionalities (e.g., Alarm, Stopwatch). It initializes UI components, manages app shortcuts, handles navigation between fragments via ViewPager, and controls toolbar menu visibility based on selected tabs.
